Conocimientos Pedagógicos.contexto:
Read and answer questions 51, 52, 53, 54 and 55.
Alberto has brought the following text for a reading session with his third graders:

Time to celebrate

People from all over the world are accustomed to different norms and beliefs and celebrate important events in different ways. Take a look at how the following three events are celebrated in different countries.

• New Year
Children in Taiwan love the Chinese New Year because they get hong bao (red envelopes with money inside) from their relatives. On the other hand, in Ecuador, people say good-bye to the old year by burning life-size dummies dressed in old clothes on big bonfires. These dummies represent something that had a negative impact on the community or someone's well-being.

• Birthdays
In Korea, on a baby's first birthday, parents put money, thread, and pencils in front of their baby. If the baby picks up the money, it means he or she is going to be rich. Choosing the thread means a long life for the baby, and choosing a pencil means he or she is going to be a good student. Meanwhile, in India, kids wear brand new clothes on their birthdays and show their parents signs of respect by touching their parents' feet.

• Weddings
In Colombia, the bride and groom each light a candle. Then they light a third candle together and blow out the first two. The third candle means that they are now one and are going to share their lives together. Whereas, in the United Kingdom, Australia, and North America, brides wear "something old, something new, something borrowed, and something blue" for good luck. Simultaneously, in Turkey, the female friends of the bride write their names inside her shoes. After the wedding ceremony, the bride looks inside her shoes. If she can no longer read one of her friends' names, it means that friend is going to get married next.

Adapted from McCarthy, M. & McCarten J. & Sandiford, H. (2014). Touchstone student's book 2 (2a ed.). New York: CUP

preguntas.pregunta:
Alberto asks his students to read the text and look for the following information:
• traditions using fire
• traditions about money
• traditions related to clothes

Which of the following reading skills is Alberto trying to reinforce with his activity?
preguntas.solucionario: La respuesta correcta es la opción A (Scanning), ya que el docente pide buscar información específica (fuego, dinero, ropa) dentro del texto.

preguntas.pregunta: Alberto wants his students to infer information from the text. Which of the following questions is appropriate to achieve his purpose?
opciones: Why do children in Taiwan love Chinese New Year?
Why do kids in India touch their parents' feet during birthdays?
Why do couples blow out the first two candles during weddings in Colombia?
preguntas.respuesta: Why do couples blow out the first two candles during weddings in Colombia?
preguntas.solucionario: La respuesta correcta es la opción C. Las otras opciones tienen respuestas explícitas en el texto, mientras que la razón de apagar las velas (dejar atrás la individualidad para ser uno solo) requiere inferencia basada en el simbolismo descrito.

preguntas.pregunta:
Alberto's students are expressing their thoughts about the text. Here is what Camilo expressed:
"Wedding traditions in Peru are different. For example, in my community, brides throw a bouquet and other girls try to catch it. The winner is supposed to get married."

Which of the following reading skills is Camilo mainly applying in his intervention?
preguntas.solucionario: La respuesta correcta es la opción B (Contextualizing), ya que el estudiante está relacionando el texto con su propio contexto cultural y experiencia personal.

preguntas.pregunta:
Alberto wants his students to interpret one of the traditions described in the text they have just read. He asks them to work in groups to discuss the following question: "Why do people in Ecuador burn dummies dressed in old clothes for New Year's Day?"
Here are some of the students' answers:

Fabricio: "They want to say good-bye to the old year."
Joaquín: "People want to leave behind the bad experiences they had last year."
César: "Dummies represent something that had negative impact on the community or someone's well-being."

Which student has given an interpretation of the tradition?
preguntas.solucionario: La respuesta correcta es la opción B. Joaquín interpreta el significado simbólico del acto (dejar atrás malas experiencias), mientras que los otros estudiantes citan hechos literales o parafrasean el texto.

preguntas.pregunta: Alberto wants to work on a post-reading task to help his students develop their writing skills. Which of the following activities is more appropriate for his purpose?
opciones: The teacher asks the students to make a to-do list for New Year's Eve. They have to include all the tasks they need to do during that day.
The teacher brings copies of incomplete invitation cards to a New Year party. The students have to complete the following information: name, address, time and date.
The teacher tells the students to write about the way Peruvians celebrate New Year's Eve. They have to mention the activities people do and the importance of that celebration.
preguntas.respuesta: The teacher tells the students to write about the way Peruvians celebrate New Year's Eve. They have to mention the activities people do and the importance of that celebration.
preguntas.solucionario: La respuesta correcta es la opción C. Esta actividad requiere producción escrita más extensa y conectada con el tema del texto, fomentando el desarrollo de habilidades de escritura más allá de listas simples o llenado de formularios.

Conocimientos Pedagógicos.contexto:
Alejandro is going to teach his students how to write a formal letter using the Product approach. He has planned the following teaching sequence:
• First, the teacher puts the students in groups and gives each group a sample formal letter. Based on this sample, the groups analyze the format and the expressions used in formal letters.
• Then the teacher elicits from the students the parts of a formal letter: salutation, body and closure, and writes them on the board.
• In their notebooks, the students make an outline of their letter taking into account the parts of a formal letter.
• Then, individually, the students write a formal letter considering the sample analyzed at the beginning, as well as their outlines.
• Finally, the teacher collects the letters for correction.

preguntas.pregunta: Which of the following Product approach stages is missing in Alejandro's teaching sequence?
preguntas.solucionario: La respuesta correcta es la opción B. En el enfoque de Producto (Product Approach), falta la etapa de práctica controlada antes de la escritura libre.

Conocimientos Pedagógicos.contexto:
Read the following situation and answer questions 57 and 58.
Daniela's students are going to listen to the audio of a conversation between two radio speakers talking about summer jobs. Here is the conversation she will play:

Jackie: So, we'll be talking about summer jobs. Richard, tell us about one of your summer jobs.
Richard: I used to work as an assistant in the school stadium. It was really fun because it was outdoors, and I got to talk to a lot of people. What about one of your jobs, Jackie?
Jackie: One summer, I worked in a section of the supermarket selling ice-cream.
Richard: And did you enjoy that?
Jackie: Actually, yeah! It was nice to meet people and talk to the customers.

preguntas.pregunta: Before playing the audio, Daniela wants to help her students develop their listening skill Predicting content. Which of the following strategies is it more appropriate to carry out?
opciones: The teacher writes three sentences on the board: "Jackie had a job in a supermarket", "Richard enjoyed his job as an assistant", and "Jackie worked near her house." Then the students guess which of these sentences will be part of the audio.

The teacher writes, on the board, the following words from the listening: "summer", "assistant", "fun", "supermarket", "enjoy" and "customers." Then, in small groups, the students use those words to discuss what they think the audio will be about.

The teacher writes, on the board, the topic of the listening: "summer jobs." Then she elicits some words related to it and writes them next to the topic. She tells the students to work in pairs to discuss what summer jobs they think will be in the audio.
preguntas.respuesta: The teacher writes, on the board, the following words from the listening: "summer", "assistant", "fun", "supermarket", "enjoy" and "customers." Then, in small groups, the students use those words to discuss what they think the audio will be about.
preguntas.solucionario: La respuesta correcta es la opción B, ya que usar palabras clave del audio para formular hipótesis sobre el contenido es una estrategia efectiva para predecir (Predicting content).

preguntas.pregunta:
After listening to the audio, Daniela tells her students to answer the following questions:
• What did Jackie sell?
• Where did Richard work?
• During which season did both speakers use to work?

Which of the following listening skills is Daniela trying to promote?
preguntas.solucionario: La respuesta correcta es la opción C. Las preguntas requieren identificar detalles puntuales (qué vendió, dónde trabajó, estación del año), lo que corresponde a escuchar para obtener información específica.

Conocimientos Pedagógicos.contexto:
Eduardo wants to help his students develop their oral skills. He has designed the following teaching sequence:
• The students watch a video about traffic issues (traffic jams, bad driving, etc.) in different cities around the world. Next, in pairs, the students discuss their impressions about the video.
• Then the teacher writes the following questions on the board: "What do you think about the traffic in our city?", "What can our authorities do to deal with traffic issues?" and "How can we contribute to the authorities' efforts?"
• Next, the teacher forms groups of three and asks the students to discuss the questions and write their conclusions on a flipchart.
• After that, the groups give an oral presentation in front of the class and answer some other questions made by the audience.
• Finally, the teacher asks the students to report how they organized the activity and what difficulties they found during the process.

preguntas.pregunta: Which of the following methods has NOT been promoted in Eduardo's teaching sequence?
preguntas.solucionario: La respuesta correcta es la opción B. La secuencia se centra en resolver problemas y realizar tareas comunicativas, no en la enseñanza explícita de contenidos de una asignatura a través del inglés (CBL).

Conocimientos Pedagógicos.contexto:
Manuela's students are going to give an oral presentation about "global warming and its possible consequences on the planet." She asks her students to build their arguments using the following expressions:
• It is likely to...
• They won't be...
• There might be...
• There will definitely be...

preguntas.pregunta: Which of the following language functions corresponds to the expressions Manuela wants her students to practice?
preguntas.solucionario: La respuesta correcta es la opción A. Las expresiones 'likely to', 'won't be', 'might be' y 'will definitely be' se utilizan para hablar sobre eventos futuros probables o posibles.

Conocimientos Pedagógicos.contexto: Claudia's students have been working on giving directions to places. Now, she wants to take advantage of this context to help her students improve their speaking skills in a meaningful way.

preguntas.pregunta: Which of the following strategies is least appropriate for the teacher's purpose?
opciones: The teacher pairs up the students and assigns them a role. Student A is a foreigner who gets lost and student B is a local citizen. The foreigner asks how to get to some specific places in town and the local citizen gives him directions.

The teacher displays, on the board, a map of the neighborhood showing places and their locations. She writes prompts such as: "How do I get to...?", "Go straight", "Turn left", etc. In pairs, the students ask for and give directions to get to some of those places.

The teacher gives each student a conversation between a police officer and a tourist who is asking for directions. She tells them to practice the conversation with different classmates changing some prepositions and places every time they talk to a new peer.
preguntas.respuesta: The teacher gives each student a conversation between a police officer and a tourist who is asking for directions. She tells them to practice the conversation with different classmates changing some prepositions and places every time they talk to a new peer.
preguntas.solucionario: La respuesta correcta es la opción C. Esta opción es la 'menos apropiada' (least appropriate) porque se basa en la repetición mecánica de un diálogo dado, lo cual es menos significativo y comunicativo que las otras opciones.

Conocimientos Pedagógicos.contexto:
Read the following situation and answer questions 62 and 63.
Ximena's students have written an e-mail inviting someone to visit them to spend New Year's Eve. Now, Ximena is revising her students' writings to give them constructive feedback.

62 Tabata, one of her students, has handed in the following e-mail:
From: Tabata
To: Leonardo
Subject: New Year's Eve

Hello, Leonardo
How is Canada? How is you? Last year my mother cooked in New Year's Eve, she cooked delicius. We has turkey, potatos, vegetables, chocolate, chicha. I liked it and my mom were happy. In 2019 we will have food, drinks, gifts, music. Come visit me in New Year's Eve.
See you.

Greetings from Peru.
Tabata

Here is the feedback Ximena has written for Tabata:
"Dear Tabata, there are some problems in your writing. Check verb agreement, spelling and punctuation, please. Write a new version of your e-mail and hand it in to me next week. You can do it better."

preguntas.pregunta: Considering the teacher's purpose of giving the students constructive feedback, which of the following criticisms is appropriate?
opciones: The teacher has given a shallow feedback. She should have given examples of the errors the student made.
The teacher has mainly corrected mechanics. She should have focused on the purpose of the task instead.
The teacher has used complex language. She should have used familiar words so that the student understands the feedback easily.
preguntas.respuesta: The teacher has mainly corrected mechanics. She should have focused on the purpose of the task instead.
preguntas.solucionario: La respuesta correcta es la opción B. El feedback se centró solo en la gramática y ortografía, ignorando si se cumplió el propósito comunicativo de la invitación.

preguntas.pregunta:
Here is the e-mail Jorge, another student, wrote:
From: Jorge
To: Zulema
Subject: Visit in New Year's Eve
Hi, Zulema!
I invite you to celebrate New Year's Eve in my house in Peru we celebrate New Year's Eve in December we do party, and dance people use yellow clothes we cook chicken, and drink wine. We eat grapes at 12 you have fun
Take care
Jorge

Ximena wants to give Jorge constructive feedback so that he reflects on his mistakes. Which of the following pieces of advice is more appropriate for Ximena's purpose?
opciones: "The content of your writing is ok. However, there are some punctuation mistakes in it. I have included commas and periods where necessary."
"The message is clear, but you haven't used commas and periods adequately. Remember commas help you separate clauses and periods introduce new ideas."
"The purpose of inviting someone was achieved. On the other hand, what do you think about the punctuation? How can you improve the flow of your message?"
preguntas.respuesta: "The purpose of inviting someone was achieved. On the other hand, what do you think about the punctuation? How can you improve the flow of your message?"
preguntas.solucionario: La respuesta correcta es la opción C. Este feedback es constructivo y promueve la reflexión del estudiante sobre sus propios errores y cómo mejorar, en lugar de simplemente corregirlos.

Conocimientos Pedagógicos.contexto:
After having been working on the topic "daily routines" for some sessions, Guillermo wants his students to develop their oral fluency on that topic. He puts the students in pairs and gives each pair a picture of a famous singer. He asks them to take turns describing the singer's daily routine. While monitoring, the teacher notices that a couple of students say the following sentences: "He is get up at 10:00 am" and "He don't have to work."

Given that situation, which strategy is it appropriate for Guillermo to carry out?

preguntas.pregunta: Given that situation, which strategy is it appropriate for Guillermo to carry out?
opciones: Kindly, interrupt the two students and indicate their errors. Then give them a short explanation about the correct use of the simple present tense.
Don't make any comments on the students' mistakes and let them finish. Then, when the activity is over, remind all the students how the simple present tense is formed.
Approach each student that has problems using the simple present tense. Echo the student's sentence emphasizing the problem and ask him to say the sentence again.
preguntas.respuesta: Don't make any comments on the students' mistakes and let them finish. Then, when the activity is over, remind all the students how the simple present tense is formed.
preguntas.solucionario: La respuesta correcta es la opción B. Dado que el objetivo de la actividad es desarrollar la fluidez oral (oral fluency), interrumpir a los estudiantes para corregirlos (opciones A y C) cortaría el flujo de la comunicación. La estrategia adecuada es la corrección diferida.

Conocimientos Pedagógicos.contexto: Belinda's students are participating in a guessing game in which they have to give descriptions of people, places and things.

preguntas.pregunta: Which of the following grammatical structures is most appropriate for the language function Describing people, places and things?
preguntas.solucionario: La respuesta correcta es la opción B. Los adjetivos son la categoría gramatical fundamental utilizada para calificar y describir sustantivos (personas, lugares y cosas).

Conocimientos Pedagógicos.contexto:
Read the following situation and answer questions 66, 67 and 68.
Mariela's students are going to listen to a song of a famous singer. Here is the chorus of the song:

I love her so much. That's what I feel.
I love the tenderly kisses my lover brings to me, they are more beautiful than anything else can be.
I know my love will last forever.

preguntas.pregunta: Which of the following language functions can the teacher promote using the text above?
preguntas.solucionario: La respuesta correcta es la opción B. Frases como "they are more beautiful than anything else can be" se utilizan para dar cumplidos o halagos (Complimenting).

preguntas.pregunta: After having worked on different activities using the song, Mariela would like her students to develop the listening skill Inferring attitude. Taking her purpose into account, which of the following strategies is it appropriate to adopt?
opciones: Play the audio of the song and write the following questions on the board: "How does the singer feel?" and "How can you tell?" Ask the students to work in pairs and discuss those questions.
Play the audio of the song and ask the students to write down the verbs they hear. Pair up the students and have them identify the main idea of the song using the verbs they have written down.

Play the audio of the song and write the following sentences on the board: "When I listened to the song, I felt..." and "I liked/didn't like the song because..." Ask the students to complete those sentences in their notebooks.
preguntas.respuesta: Play the audio of the song and write the following questions on the board: "How does the singer feel?" and "How can you tell?" Ask the students to work in pairs and discuss those questions.
preguntas.solucionario: La respuesta correcta es la opción A. Para inferir la actitud (Inferring attitude), los estudiantes deben analizar los sentimientos del hablante/cantante, no los propios (opción C) ni solo elementos gramaticales (opción B).

preguntas.pregunta: Now, Mariela wants her students to improve their productive skills through a post-listening task. Which of the following tasks is it least appropriate to use?
opciones: The students are given a copy of the song with some blanks to be filled in. They get in pairs and complete the blanks.
The students receive a copy of the song. The teacher asks them to choose their favorite verse and explain the reasons for their choice.
The students create a dialogue between the singer and his lover. The students practice their dialogue for some minutes and present it to the class.
preguntas.respuesta: The students are given a copy of the song with some blanks to be filled in. They get in pairs and complete the blanks.
preguntas.solucionario: La respuesta correcta es la opción A. Llenar espacios en blanco (cloze) es una actividad receptiva o de enfoque en la forma, no una tarea de producción (speaking/writing) creativa como se requiere en una fase de post-listening para habilidades productivas.

Conocimientos Pedagógicos.contexto: During last class, Lorena's students worked on the topic "environmental problems." Now, she wants to help her students develop their speaking skills through a free activity. According to the teacher's goal, which of the following strategies is it more appropriate to carry out?

preguntas.pregunta: According to the teacher's goal, which of the following strategies is it more appropriate to carry out?
opciones: The teacher groups the students and asks each group to choose an environmental problem. The students reflect on the problem and propose solutions for it. Each group presents their proposals to the rest of the class.

The teacher provides the students with a dialogue between two friends talking about environmental problems. The teacher pairs up the students and assigns each student a role. The students practice the dialogue for some minutes.

The teacher writes the following questions on the board: "Which environmental problem is affecting our country nowadays?" and "Have the authorities adopted environmental policies to solve that problem?" The students exchange their answers in pairs.
preguntas.respuesta: The teacher groups the students and asks each group to choose an environmental problem. The students reflect on the problem and propose solutions for it. Each group presents their proposals to the rest of the class.
preguntas.solucionario: La respuesta correcta es la opción A. Una actividad libre (free activity) implica que los estudiantes usen el lenguaje de manera creativa y autónoma para comunicar ideas, a diferencia de la práctica controlada (opción B) o preguntas cerradas/guiadas (opción C).

Conocimientos Pedagógicos.contexto: Angela wants her students to work on the function Expressing possibility through a speaking activity.

preguntas.pregunta: Which of the following structures is appropriate for the language function Angela wants her students to work on?
preguntas.solucionario: La respuesta correcta es la opción A. Los verbos modales (como 'may', 'might', 'could') son la estructura gramatical principal para expresar posibilidad en inglés.

Conocimientos Pedagógicos.contexto:
Read the following situation and answer questions 71, 72 and 73.
Manuel wants his fourth graders to practice Extensive listening in the classroom. He brings the audio of the following conversation:

Carmelo: I don't like traveling by bus.
Daisy: Why not?
Carmelo: The service is terrible, and I hate traffic jams!
Daisy: Well, you can take the train.
Carmelo: There are long queues. I can't stand them.
Daisy: Then ride your bike or walk.
Carmelo: I'm lazy.
Daisy: Hahaha. Come on! Stop being negative!
Carmelo: Yeah, you are right. I have to work on that.

preguntas.pregunta: Taking into account Manuel's purpose, which of the following instructions is it NOT appropriate to give when starting the activity?
opciones: "Listen to the conversation and try to identify which topic they are talking about. Remember that details are not important right now."
"Listen to the conversation and identify the expressions used to give suggestions. Remember they can be phrases, sentences or commands."
"Listen to the conversation and identify the relationship the speakers have. Remember that the speakers' attitude is important to understand what their relationship is."
preguntas.respuesta: "Listen to the conversation and identify the expressions used to give suggestions. Remember they can be phrases, sentences or commands."
preguntas.solucionario: La respuesta correcta es la opción B. El 'Extensive Listening' busca la comprensión global y el disfrute, no el análisis detallado de formas lingüísticas o gramaticales (Intensive Listening), que es lo que propone la opción B.

preguntas.pregunta:
After listening to the conversation, one student raises his hand and asks: "Teacher, what are queues?"
Which of the following actions is it more appropriate for Manuel to carry out?
opciones: Tell the student the definition of "queue" in English. If he doesn't understand it, translate the word "queue" into Spanish.
Explain to the students that queue is a British word and its synonym in American English is row. Ask the student if he got the idea or not.
Ask four students to come to the front and line up one behind the other. Ask the whole class what their peers are doing and where people usually stand like that.
preguntas.respuesta: Ask four students to come to the front and line up one behind the other. Ask the whole class what their peers are doing and where people usually stand like that.
preguntas.solucionario: La respuesta correcta es la opción C. El uso de demostraciones físicas (Realía/TPR) y contexto es pedagógicamente más efectivo y memorable para estudiantes de cuarto grado que definiciones abstractas o traducciones.

preguntas.pregunta: Manuel wants to use the conversation to promote critical thinking. Which of the following questions is it most appropriate to ask?
opciones: Why doesn't Carmelo like traveling by bus?
How may Carmelo's negative attitude affect his life?
What means of transportation would you recommend Carmelo to use?
preguntas.respuesta: How may Carmelo's negative attitude affect his life?
preguntas.solucionario: La respuesta correcta es la opción B. Esta pregunta invita a la reflexión profunda, inferencia y análisis de consecuencias más allá del texto, promoviendo el pensamiento crítico.

Conocimientos Pedagógicos.contexto:
Read the following teaching sequence and answer questions 74, 75 and 76.
Karina wants to help her students develop their productive skills through the topic "free time activities." For that purpose, she has designed a teaching sequence divided into three steps.

preguntas.pregunta: First, Karina wants to activate her students' prior knowledge on that topic. Given the teacher's purpose, which of the following activities is least appropriate?
opciones: Play a video about free time activities people usually do. Tell the students to identify the names of those activities and write them down in their notebooks. Call on some volunteers to share their answers.
Write "free time activities" on the board and tell the students to think of all the words they can relate to that phrase. Invite some students to go to the board and write the words they thought of.
Show the students some pictures of free time activities. Ask the students which of those activities and/or others they do in their free time. Have them exchange ideas and then call on volunteers.
preguntas.respuesta: Play a video about free time activities people usually do. Tell the students to identify the names of those activities and write them down in their notebooks. Call on some volunteers to share their answers.
preguntas.solucionario: La respuesta correcta es la opción A. Esta actividad es de comprensión auditiva y evaluación (identificar y escribir correctamente), lo cual es cognitivamente más exigente y cerrado que una actividad de activación de saberes previos como lluvia de ideas o discusión de imágenes.

preguntas.pregunta:
As the next step of her lesson, Karina has planned the following activity:
• Give each student the following survey for them to mark their answers individually:

Free time activities
Read the questions and check all the answers that apply
What do you enjoy doing in your free time?
[ ] Play sports
[ ] Listen to music
[ ] Watch movies
[ ] Others: _____

Do you do these activities on your own or with others?
[ ] On my own
[ ] With others
[ ] Both

How often do you do these activities?
[ ] Frequently
[ ] Once a week
[ ] Rarely

• Give the students the following instructions:
"In groups, compare your answers. Find similarities and differences between the activities you and your classmates enjoy doing."

Which of the following language functions can best be promoted with the activity presented by Karina?
preguntas.solucionario: La respuesta correcta es la opción A. La encuesta pregunta "What do you enjoy doing...", lo cual está directamente relacionado con expresar gustos y preferencias.

preguntas.pregunta:
To continue working on her lesson, Karina has planned the following sequence:
• First, the teacher tells the students that they are going to write their own survey taking into account the survey presented in the previous activity.
• Then she forms groups of four students and gives the following instructions: "Each group has to write one survey. The survey has to include five questions that help you know the free time activities your classmates enjoy doing."
• The students work in their groups to decide what questions to include in the survey while the teacher monitors and provides help when necessary.
• Next, the students use the survey they elaborated to interview peers from other groups and then report their findings to the class.
• Finally, the teacher asks the students to analyze the kind of language used in their surveys (Wh-questions/Yes-no questions, adverbs of frequency, etc.). She also asks them in which other situations they can use that language.

Which of the following teaching methods has Karina applied in the sequence presented?
preguntas.solucionario: La respuesta correcta es la opción A. La secuencia sigue las fases del Aprendizaje Basado en Tareas (TBL): Pre-task (activación), Task Cycle (planeación, ejecución y reporte de la encuesta) y Language Focus (análisis gramatical al final).

Conocimientos Pedagógicos.contexto:
Augusto's students are going to work in pairs in order to practice how to make invitations. After Augusto assigns each student a role and gives instructions for the activity, he provides the students with the following expressions:
• Unfortunately, now is not the best time for me.
• Normally, I would say it's great, but...
• I would love to help you, but...

preguntas.pregunta: Considering the expressions provided, which of the following language functions is mainly going to be promoted in Augusto's activity?
preguntas.solucionario: La respuesta correcta es la opción A. Todas las expresiones listadas ("Unfortunately...", "I would love to... but") se usan para rechazar una invitación o petición de manera educada.

Conocimientos Pedagógicos.contexto: Dina wants to help her students develop their speaking skills through the topic "water scarcity." Which of the following activities is most meaningful for the students?

preguntas.pregunta: Which of the following activities is most meaningful for the students?
opciones: Group the students and ask them to give an oral presentation about water scarcity around the world. Tell them to include statistics to support their ideas. They will elaborate a catchy presentation to get others interested in the topic.

Ask the students to elaborate an interview between an environmental engineer and a journalist about water scarcity in their country. Tell them to include interesting questions and answers. They will present their interviews in front of the class.

Pair up the students and ask them to design an action plan to face water scarcity in their community. Tell them to discuss the objectives, strategies, and resources they will include in it. They will present their action plans to decide which one is the most suitable to apply.
preguntas.respuesta: Pair up the students and ask them to design an action plan to face water scarcity in their community. Tell them to discuss the objectives, strategies, and resources they will include in it. They will present their action plans to decide which one is the most suitable to apply.
preguntas.solucionario: La respuesta correcta es la opción C. Para que una actividad sea significativa (meaningful), debe ser relevante para la realidad inmediata de los estudiantes. Diseñar un plan de acción para su propia comunidad involucra resolución de problemas reales y personalización, a diferencia de presentaciones generales (A) o roles ficticios (B).

Conocimientos Pedagógicos.contexto:
Read the following situation and answer questions 79 and 80.
Jose's students are going to write a short essay on "the advantages and disadvantages of having a pet." He has designed the following sequence:
• On the board, the teacher draws a chart and divides it into the following categories: "advantages of having a pet" and "disadvantages of having a pet." In their notebooks, the students write some ideas under each category.
• After that, the teacher tells the students that they have to make an outline using the ideas in the chart.
• Then, using their outlines, the students write their first version of the essay.
• Next, the teacher asks them to improve their first version by adding topic sentences and supporting ideas in each paragraph.
• Later, the students exchange their essays and correct all the mistakes they find.
• Finally, the teacher collects the essays.

preguntas.pregunta: Which approach to writing is Jose promoting?
preguntas.solucionario: La respuesta correcta es la opción C. La secuencia descrita (lluvia de ideas, esquema, borrador, revisión de contenido, edición de errores) corresponde a las etapas del enfoque de Proceso (Process Approach), que valora la creación del texto como un proceso recursivo.

preguntas.pregunta: Which writing skill needs to be improved in the sequence presented by Jose?
preguntas.solucionario: La respuesta correcta es la opción C. El paso donde el docente pide "improve their first version by adding topic sentences..." es una intervención de revisión (Revising), enfocada en mejorar la estructura y el contenido, lo cual indica que es la habilidad que se está trabajando o reforzando en esa etapa específica.

preguntas.solucionario: La respuesta correcta es la opción B. Se trata de una 'cleft sentence' (It was I who...), donde el pronombre relativo 'who' se refiere a la persona 'I'.
La respuesta correcta es la opción B. El verbo 'light' (pasado 'lit') es el que colocalmente se usa con 'cigarette' (encender un cigarrillo).
La respuesta correcta es la opción A. 'Beside' significa 'al lado de'. 'Next' requeriría la preposición 'to' (next to).
La respuesta correcta es la opción B. La colocación correcta es 'drag on a cigarette' (dar una calada al cigarrillo).
La respuesta correcta es la opción C. Se necesita un conector de propósito seguido de un infinitivo ('meet'). 'For' iría seguido de gerundio o sustantivo; 'so that' iría seguido de una cláusula.
La respuesta correcta es la opción A. 'Could' expresa posibilidad o habilidad en el pasado ('before I could touch her' - antes de que pudiera tocarla).
La respuesta correcta es la opción B. La estructura 'will have' corresponde al Futuro Perfecto, el cual requiere el participio pasado del verbo ('forgotten').

Conocimientos Pedagógicos.contexto:
Read the following paragraph and choose among the underlined phrases, the one that contains an error.
One sunny afternoon, a soldier was resting over the grass by the side of a road. He was sleeping soundly upon his stomach and his head lying on his left arm.

preguntas.pregunta: Which of the underlined phrases contains an error?
preguntas.solucionario: La respuesta correcta es la opción A. La preposición correcta para indicar ubicación sobre una superficie (como el césped) es 'on'. 'Over' generalmente implica movimiento por encima o estar suspendido sobre algo sin contacto, o cubriendo algo.

Conocimientos Pedagógicos.contexto:
Read the following paragraph and choose among the underlined verbs, the one that does NOT correspond to the context presented.
The soldier extended his right hand and took his rifle. In that position, he assembled dead. However, if detected, he would be dead afterward due to the crime he had committed.

preguntas.pregunta: Which of the underlined verbs does NOT correspond to the context presented?
preguntas.solucionario: La respuesta correcta es la opción B. 'Assembled' (ensambló/reunió) no tiene sentido en el contexto de hacerse el muerto. Probablemente el verbo pretendido era 'feigned' (fingió) o 'played'.

Conocimientos Pedagógicos.contexto:
Read the following paragraph and choose among the underlined connectors, the one that does NOT correspond to the context presented.
Countries are not so wild or difficult, as far as men make them a place of war. For instance, an army in possession of the frontiers could bring a nation either death or suffering.

preguntas.pregunta: Which of the underlined connectors does NOT correspond to the context presented?
preguntas.solucionario: La respuesta correcta es la opción A. El conector 'as far as' (en la medida que/por lo que) no establece la relación lógica correcta en la oración. El contexto sugiere una condición o excepción (ej. 'unless' o 'except when').
